title: Wall Street Weekahead: Trade protection doesn't have to exclude growth stocks

title: Stock market ends higher ahead of Memorial Day holiday, but Dow logs longest weekly skid in 8 years
text: U.S. stock benchmarks closed out a woeful week for higher on Friday, heading into the Memorial Day holiday.  Reports that President Donald Trump may ease restrictions against Huawei Technologies Inc. as part of a bigger trade deal with China, helped to fuel some modest levels of optimism.

title: Wall St. clings to slight gains after Trump sparks U.S.-China trade hopes
text: Wall Street's major indexes edged higher on Friday in a rebound from the previous session's losses after upbeat comments from U.S. President Donald Trump regarding trade relations with China assuaged concerns among some investors.

title: China accuses U.S. officials of misleading public on trade war
text: China on Friday accused U.S. officials of lying to the public about their trade war, as rising tensions between the world's two largest economies kept financial markets in a state of unease.

text: Hollywood’s largest talent agency, Endeavor Group, is going public. The company, led by Ari Emanuel, filed for an initial public offering Thursday.

title: Facebook says the doctored Nancy Pelosi video used to question her mental state will stay up
text: An altered video of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi made rounds on social media this week, which critics used to attack her mental state.

title: JP Morgan slashes second-quarter GDP forecast to just 1%
text: J.P. Morgan Chase economists said they now see second quarter growth of just 1%, down from their prior forecast of 2.25% and way off the 3.2% reported in the first quarter.

text: One of the biggest Chinese chipmakers is delisting from the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Goldman bumps up no-deal Brexit odds after May resignation
text: Goldman Sachs raised its probability of a no-deal Brexit to 15% from 10% on Friday as Prime Minister Theresa May's resignation potentially opened the way for a more hardline politician to lead the UK to exiting the European Union.

title: Wall Street gains as trade tensions ease
text: U.S. stocks posted broad-based gains on Friday, ahead of a long weekend, as sentiment was buoyed by optimistic comments by President Donald Trump that the protracted trade war with China could soon end.

title: Huawei shipments could fall by up to a quarter this year: analysts
text: China's Huawei, hit by crippling U.S. sanctions, could see shipments decline by as much as a quarter this year and faces the possibility that its smartphones will disappear from international markets, analysts said.

text: Less than a month after the storied New Orleans Times-Picayune laid off all 161 members of its staff, another paper has done the same.

title: Crypto exchange Binance prepares to add margin trading ‘soon’
text: Binance, the world’s most prominent crypto exchange, says it is close to adding a much-anticipated margin trading feature to its service following weeks of speculation.

title: Theresa May announces she will step down as UK prime minister on June 7
text: May had failed to win a parliamentary majority on Britain's withdrawal from the European Union.

title: Nigeria’s Gokada raises $5.3M round for its motorcycle ride-hail biz
text: In many large cities across Africa, motorcycle taxies are as common as yellow-cabs in New York. That includes Lagos, Nigeria, where ride-hail startup Gokada has raised a $5.3 million Series A round to grow its two-wheel transit business.

title: China airline association estimates losses from 737 MAX grounding at $579 million
text: The China Air Transport Association (CATA) on Friday said it expects losses at Chinese airlines caused by the grounding of Boeing Co's 737 MAX aircraft to be around 4 billion yuan ($579.32 million) by the end of June.

title: Huawei has enough inventory to 'weather' US blacklist for months: Analyst
text: Chinese technology giant Huawei has enough inventory to sustain its smartphone and 5G networking equipment business for most of the rest of the year, according to brokerage and investment firm CLSA.

title: China is driving growth in Asia's real estate market despite trade war headwinds, report finds
text: Despite a decline in global commercial real estate markets, Asia-Pacific continues to enjoy a record-breaking growth — thanks to China, according to the Global Capital Flows report by JLL.

title: SpaceX launches dozens of 'Starlink' internet satellites into space — its heaviest payload ever
text: SpaceX sent 60 satellites into space in a key first mission toward the company's own high-speed internet network.
